column4: How can i backup my data using 7.10 LiveCD, I tried 'sudo mount /dev/sda1 /folder" and it still is not giving me owner permissions...
XJonnyx134: try pressing F6 when it goes to the boot menu, then before the --'s put pci=noacpi and it should work
64 bit does not have flash??
no, but there are work-arounds
man mount
man mount?
yes. 'man' is the command used to view manual pages
try mounting it somewhere under the /mnt hierarchy first and see if that works
ok, ill try that, thanks, brb

i cant get it working, its an ext3 hard drive, i tried mounting it with 'sudo mount -o nomand,nosuid,rw,user,remount /dev/sda1 /mnt' and that still does not let me access folders that contain the data i need
as sudo do ls -ltr /path/to/mounted/volume and see if the owner is listed as root or some arbitrary user id (e.g., 1002, etc)
its a user id (1000 to be exact)
and what user are you attempting to access it as?
im trying to access it as root on LiveCD
you should be able to access it as root then
i know =\, i dont understand why it wont let me access the data, i try to go to the folder and it tells me im not the owner of it..
try using cd in a terminal as root
yes, it lets me in them then
sudo su ; cd /path/to/mounted/volume ; ls -l
then the x session you are running is logged in as a different user other than root (as you should be(
hahah great, 7.10 64 bit just froze, took it awhile..
the kernel locked or firefox locked?
